alert.note: Alert for Southern Middlesex; Southern New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:33PM EST until January 10 at 12:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO NOON EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...2 to 2 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline with the Wednesday morning high tide. * WHERE...Southern Middlesex and Southern New London Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM to noon EST Wednesday. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread moderate flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline Wednesday morning. Expect 2 to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This will result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 3 to 6 ft during the Wednesday morning high tide. This will result in beach erosion, and wave splashover onto shoreline roads and properties. * RIVERINE IMPACTS...Freshwater runoff coinciding with the Wednesday morning high tide will exacerbate street and property flooding issues along tidal reaches of rivers in southeastern CT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Peak surge of 4 to 5 ft will likely be between times of high tide this evening and Wednesday morning. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NEW HAVEN HARBOR AT NEW HAVEN CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 8.7 FT, MODERATE 9.3 FT, MAJOR 10.6 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/10 PM 8.7/ 9.2 2.0/ 2.5 3.1/ 3.6 3-5 MINOR 10/09 AM 8.7/ 9.2 2.0/ 2.5 2.2/ 2.7 3-4 MINOR 10/10 PM 5.6/ 6.1 -1.1/-0.7 -0.2/ 0.2 2-3 NONE 11/11 AM 7.3/ 7.8 0.6/ 1.1 0.2/ 0.7 1 NONE 11/11 PM 6.2/ 6.8 -0.5/ 0.0 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE THAMES RIVER AT NEW LONDON CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 7.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/08 PM 4.7/ 5.2 1.6/ 2.0 2.7/ 3.2 2-4 MINOR 10/06 AM 6.1/ 6.6 3.0/ 3.5 3.7/ 4.2 3-6 MODERATE 10/08 PM 2.2/ 2.7 -1.0/-0.5 0.1/ 0.6 4-5 NONE 11/08 AM 3.2/ 3.7 0.2/ 0.7 0.2/ 0.8 2 NONE 11/09 PM 2.7/ 3.2 -0.3/ 0.2 0.6/ 1.1 2 NONE 12/10 AM 4.0/ 4.5 0.9/ 1.4 0.8/ 1.3 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
